revised_title: Enzymatic Hydrolysis of Penicillin: Formation of 6-Aminopenicillanic Acid
tldr: The authors discovered that penicillin amidase, an enzyme found in various microorganisms, can hydrolyze different types of penicillin to form 6-aminopenicillanic acid. They found that Streptomyces lavendulae produced an exocellular penicillin amidase that effectively hydrolyzed phenoxymethylpenicillin. This discovery led to the development of more efficient methods for producing 6-aminopenicillanic acid, a key component in the synthesis of various penicillin derivatives.
